result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emillion M. Dominguez

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #22CF215 and #22CF216  called at 11:08am 
Co-Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez appears.
Co-Defendant Roberto I Navarro appears. Attorney Daniel Nedset appears.
ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the Zoom connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case #22CF215:  the Court directs that the Public Defenders Office continue efforts to appointment counsel for Mr. Dominguez.
As to Case #22CF216:  Attorney Nedset requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing. 
recess 11:15am.  

NEXT:  Status Conference in Case #22CF215 and Plea & Sentencing in Case #22CF216--both on November 11th at 11:00am;  Co-Defendant Dominguez may appear by Zoom conference for this hearing.
Status of Counsel
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

to Withdraw--Klein 

ec: DA and Atty Klein (9/16/22--ma)
OK

[ma] Case called at 9:17am
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein appeared by zoom for Emillion M. Dominguez.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

On Atty Klein's Motion to Withdraw: 
--the Court allows Atty Klein's withdrawal
--the public defender's office is directed to appoint successor counsel
--Atty Klein is to notify public defender successor counsel is needed. 

Atty Klein leaves zoom meeting at 9:20am

Cases 22CF217 & 22CF216 called at 9:21am 
Defendant Alexis T. Nguyen in court. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears for Alexis Nguyen. 
Defendant Roberto Navarro appears via zoom. Attorney Daniel Nedset appears via zoom for Roberto Navarro.

Atty Rumpf indicates Ms. Nguyen's case is resolved. 
Atty Nedset requests an additional status be scheduled in Mr. Navarro's case to allow review of discovery.

Scheduling is discussed. 
Mr. Dominguez provides address of: 1560 Pine St. #11, Concord, CA 94520

Ms. Nguyen's case proceeds to plea & sentencing, minutes are in Case 22CF217
recess: 9:26am 
NEXT: As to Cases 22CF215 & 22CF216, Status of 10/6/22 at 11:00am via zoom
Atty Klein's request to appear by Zoom
To be taken up at next scheduled proceedings
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Proposed Order to Withdraw
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 1:40pm. 
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf for bond purposes-Attorney Klein remains as appointed counsel in the case. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
After Attorney Rumpf provides information on Mr. Dominguez appearing in court on Friday, the Court reinstates the Cash Bond.  
recess 1:45pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on September 15th at 9:00am
Extradition Forecast
per record (motion withdrawn)

[ma] Case called at 8:42 AM [Court Reporter: Linda Kasparzak]
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Emillion M. Dominguez.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Klein has no explanation for Mr. Dominguez's non-appearance; has had communication within last couple weeks.

Atty Klein is withdrawing motion to withdraw. 

ADA Teuber requests a warrant be issued. 
The Court authorizes a warrant, STAYS until 9:00am; if issued warrant is body only.

recess: 8:44am
Proposed Order to Withdraw

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[Court Reporter: Lisa Krasigroch]
[ma] Case called at 8:53 AM 
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   ADA Krysta Parson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court vacates prior warrant authorization. 

Mr. Dominguez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:58am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/20/22 at 3:00pm    (2) Status Conference on 8/4/22 at 8:30am
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:15am 
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez does not appear. Attorney Jessica Klein appears. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
After Attorney Klein indicates that Mr. Dominguez has been in contact regarding his inability to find transportation to come to court today, the Court directs Attorney Klein to have the defendant call in. 
recess 9:17am, reconvene 9:23am
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez now appears by telephone.  
Mr. Dominguez indicates that he is currently in Fort Atkinson, however he does not have a Fort Atkinson address to provide the Court.  His 1560 Pine Street #11, Concord CA address is his mailing address.  
The Court authorizes a Warrant but stays it to the next court date, emphasizing to Mr. Dominguez that he needs to appear in person at this hearing. 
recess 9:28am 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on July 5th at 9:00am (same date/time as a Co-Def's Arraignment is scheduled)--JA note in comments that the case is a Warrant has been authorized but stayed to this date
Status conference on June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jessica Klein
Status of Counsel

[ma] Case 22CF217 called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Alexis T. Nguyen in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Ms. Nguyen waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

The Court calls case 22CF215, Emillion M Dominguez at 1:43pm
Defendant Emillion M Dominguez appears in court. 

SPD to continue effots to appoint counsel to Mr. Dominguez's case. 
recess: 1:45pm

Status of Counsel

JAs Review of 5/4/22 RUMS

ADDRESS INFO for Emillion M. Dominguez
Current: 1560 Pine St. #11, Concord, CA 94520 United States  (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 1560 Pine St., Concord, CA 94520
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/5/4/22)
Scheduling Order
Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 5/2/22
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Roberto I. Navarro, Alexis T. Nguyen (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--no use of illegal drugs; no use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[MK] case called at 1:26pm 
Defendant Emillion M. Dominguez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rumpf agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Rumpf verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Roberto I. Navarro, Alexis T. Nguyen 
--no use of illegal drugs; no use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:34pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on May 17th at 1:30pm
